name: Decisional Balance
description: Evaluating pros and cons of options to clarify preferences and consequences.
creator: Janet Bavelas
core_principles: Structured comparison of benefits and costs across choices.

name: Six Thinking Hats
description: Parallel thinking framework using six perspectives to explore a topic.
creator: Edward de Bono
core_principles: Segregate thinking modes to reduce conflict and broaden insight.

name: Root Cause Analysis
description: Technique focused on identifying the underlying cause of a problem.
creator: Sakichi Toyoda
core_principles: Five Whys questioning and causal mapping to reach the root issue.

name: SMART Goals
description: Goal-setting framework ensuring objectives are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound.
creator: George T. Doran
core_principles: Structured criteria enhance clarity and accountability.

name: SWOT Analysis
description: Assessing Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats for strategic decisions.
creator: Albert Humphrey
core_principles: Holistic situational awareness to guide action.

name: Gibbs Reflective Cycle
description: Six-stage reflective learning cycle: Description, Feelings, Evaluation, Analysis, Conclusion, and Action Plan.
creator: Graham Gibbs
core_principles: Combine descriptive recall, emotional awareness, and analysis to generate conclusions and plan improvements.

name: GROW Model
description: Coaching framework: Goal, Reality, Options, Way Forward to structure progress-oriented conversations.
creator: John Whitmore
core_principles: Socratic questioning builds awareness, ownership, and accountability for action.

name: Kolb Experiential Learning Cycle
description: Four-stage learning model: Concrete Experience, Reflective Observation, Abstract Conceptualization, Active Experimentation.
creator: David Kolb
core_principles: Learning emerges from a complete cycle linking experience, reflection, conceptualization, and experimentation.

name: Driscoll Model (What? So What? Now What?)
description: Three-question reflective structure connecting description, significance, and next actions.
creator: John Driscoll
core_principles: Minimal three-step inquiry to extract meaning and define actions from experience.

name: Schön Reflective Practice
description: Dual modes of reflection: Reflection-in-Action during work and Reflection-on-Action after the event.
creator: Donald Schön
core_principles: Practitioners think-in-action and reflect-on-action to adapt and improve professional practice.

name: OSKAR Model
description: Solution-focused coaching model: Outcome, Scaling, Know-how, Affirm and Action, Review.
creator: Paul Z. Jackson and Mark McKergow
core_principles: Focus on resources and preferred future; use scaling and affirmation to build momentum.

name: PDCA Cycle
description: Continuous improvement loop: Plan, Do, Check, Act for iterative change.
creator: W. Edwards Deming
core_principles: Small experiments with feedback and standardization to reduce risk and drive quality.

name: STAR Model
description: Behavioral narration format: Situation, Task, Action, Result to communicate competency.
creator: Behavioral interviewing practice (various)
core_principles: Structured storytelling to evidence capability and outcomes.

name: Decision Matrix
description: Score options against weighted criteria.
creator: Stuart Pugh

name: Design Thinking
description: User-centered iterative process involving Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test to foster innovation and practical solutions aligned with user needs.
creator: IDEO, Stanford d.school

name: Agile Retrospectives
description: Structured reflection sessions after sprints or iterations with team members to discuss what worked, what didn’t, and actionable improvements.
creator: Agile Software Development community

name: Lean Startup Methodology
description: Build-Measure-Learn iterative loop for developing products or services with minimal waste, validated learning, and rapid adaptation.
creator: Eric Ries

name: OKR (Objectives and Key Results)
description: Framework to set ambitious, measurable goals with defined Key Results fostering focus, alignment, and accountability.
creator: Andy Grove

name: Liberating Structures
description: Collection of microstructures to facilitate inclusive participation and unleash creativity in groups, e.g., '1-2-4-All,' 'What, So What, Now What?'.
creator: Henri Lipmanowicz, Keith McCandless

name: Cynefin Framework
description: Sense-making framework to help leaders decide actions based on categorizing problems into simple, complicated, complex, chaotic, or disorder domains.
creator: Dave Snowden

name: Remote and Hybrid Team Strategies
description: Frameworks and practices specifically for managing distributed teams, including asynchronous collaboration, virtual whiteboarding, and digital wellbeing methods.
creator: Various contributors
